alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:14AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cook County through 645 AM CDT... At 613 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles northeast of Eagle Mountain, to 16 miles north of Grand Marais, to 9 miles west of Hovland, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cook County, including the following locations... Tom Lake, Swamp Lake, North Fowl Lake, Pine Lake, Judge C. R. Magney State Park, Judge Magney State Park, Watab Lake, Clearwater Lake and Grand Portage Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore
